item.title: ⚡ Weekly Recap: Chrome 0-Day, AI Hacking Tools, DDR5 Bit-Flips, npm Worm & More
item.description:
The security landscape now moves at a pace no patch cycle can match. Attackers aren’t waiting for quarterly updates or monthly fixes—they adapt within hours, blending fresh techniques with old, forgotten flaws to create new openings. A vulnerability closed yesterday can become the blueprint for tomorrow’s breach.
This week’s recap explores the trends driving that constant churn: how threat

item.title: [$] Revocable references for transient devices
item.description: Computers were once relatively static devices; if a peripheral was present at boot, it was unlikely to disappear while the system was operating. Those days are far behind us, though; devices can come and go at any time, often with no notice. That impermanence can create challenges for kernel code, which may not be expecting resources it is managing to make an abrupt exit. The revocable resource management patch set from Tzung-Bi Shih is meant to help with the creation of more robust — and more secure — kernel subsystems in a dynamic world.

item.title: Security updates for Monday
item.description: Security updates have been issued by Debian (ffmpeg, jetty12, jetty9, jq, and pam), Fedora (curl, libssh, podman-tui, and prometheus-podman-exporter), Oracle (firefox, gnutls, kernel, and thunderbird), and SUSE (bluez, cairo, chromium, cmake, cups, firefox, frr, govulncheck-vulndb, kernel, kubevirt, virt-api-container, virt-controller-container, virt-exportproxy-container, virt-exportserver-container, virt-handler-container, virt-launcher-container, virt-libguestfs-t, mariadb, mybatis, ognl, python-h2, and rke2).

item.description:

item.title: ComicForm and SectorJ149 Hackers Deploy Formbook Malware in Eurasian Cyberattacks
item.description:
Organizations in Belarus, Kazakhstan, and Russia have emerged as the target of a phishing campaign undertaken by a previously undocumented hacking group called ComicForm since at least April 2025.
The activity primarily targeted industrial, financial, tourism, biotechnology, research, and trade sectors, cybersecurity company F6 said in an analysis published last week.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Slips Below Key Technical Indicators – Is the Bull Market Over?
item.description:
Bitcoin's price slipped below key technical indicators including the 100-day and 200-day EMAs positioned at $114,635 and $114,180 as it tested lows of $111,800, while CryptoQuant data shows the taker buy/sell ratio falling to -0.86 indicating bearish sentiment similar to January's market top that preceded a 32% decline.

The post Bitcoin Price Slips Below Key Technical Indicators – Is the Bull Market Over? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: UK and US Form Crypto Task Force to Shape Global Digital Assets Rules
item.description:
The UK and US have established a joint crypto task force to coordinate regulation, enhance capital market collaboration, and focus on stablecoins, anti-money laundering, and cross-border investment.

The post UK and US Form Crypto Task Force to Shape Global Digital Assets Rules appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Whale Suddenly Withdraws $122 Million in HYPE Coin – What’s Going On?
item.description:
A major whale withdrew $122 million worth of HYPE tokens from Hyperliquid's ecosystem within hours, sparking sell-off fears as the mysterious investor sits on over $90 million in unrealized gains while high-profile exits from Arthur Hayes and Ansem coincide with concerns over 237.8 million tokens worth $11.9 billion scheduled to unlock on November 29.

The post Whale Suddenly Withdraws $122 Million in HYPE Coin – What’s Going On? appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Crypto Inflows Hit $1.9B After Fed’s First Rate Cut of 2025
item.description:
Crypto inflows have totaled $1.9B after the Fed’s first rate cut of 2025, with Bitcoin and Ethereum leading gains and total assets under management rising to $40.4B, their highest level this year.

The post Crypto Inflows Hit $1.9B After Fed’s First Rate Cut of 2025 appeared first on Cryptonews.

item.title: Coinbase & Bilt Partnerships Propel Cardless to $60M Series C, Aiming to Transform Credit Card Industry
item.description:
Cardless, a credit card platform allowing companies to design and launch branded credit cards in-house, announced the close of a $60 million Series C funding round led by Spark Capital.

The post Coinbase & Bilt Partnerships Propel Cardless to $60M Series C, Aiming to Transform Credit Card Industry appeared first on Cryptonews.
